body.p:
To His Excellency James F. Robinson
Govenor of Kentucky

Your petitioners John Arnold & Fredrick Dangler would respectfully state that they were indicted for assault & Battery in the Louisville City Court, & were tried upon said indictment & fined fifty dollars $50 00/00. & costs.

Your petitioners keep a tavern on Market Street bet 4th & 5th Streets, & the man assaulted stoped a day & night at petitioners Tavern & attempted to depart without paying his bill, he made his way to the back of the building & was in the act of Climbing a very high fence when petitioners pulled him from the fence, & dealt him two light blows, & then conducted him to the front of the building & let him go his way. The man assaulted was disipated & without the means of living.
Your petitioners did not inflict severe injuries, nor did they intend such a thing, but did it simply to detere him from springing for his living.

Your petitioners are new beginners in Tavern keeping, & are unable to pay the fined
& costs, & they respectfully ask your Excellency to remit the fine
Pettn from Arnold &c to remit fine
